intro: Verbascum cupreum, commonly known as copperleaf or copper plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its woolly, gray-green leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its drought tolerance. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
